intro: Turnera melochioides var. latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf turnera, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Passifloraceae family, which includes passionflowers, and is characterized by its showy, often brightly colored flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, with palmately lobed leaves and a trailing or climbing habit. Its flowers feature five sepals, five petals, and a distinctive crown of filaments, which are typical of the family. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value.
